text:
On few occasions have I gone to a restaurant and had no expectations and then end up with such a subpar experience that now that yelp exists I feel it is my duty for my 100th review to help the Yelpdom. Think of it as a sort of review "slump buster".

My wife booked our party here for the mother-in-law's birthday. She enjoys Italian food and our first place was not open on the Sunday we wanted to book so this place was "recommended" to us. 

We arrive "fashionably" late for our reservation but most of our party was there for 6:30 and the first thing that strikes me is how quiet it is and how it seems like there is WAY more staff than clients (strike #1). While everyone else was there (about 10 already) with me and my 2 girls and the birthday girl as an exception, it boggled my mind when we reached 7:30pm before any order was taken in our party. 

We had a roast set up for the mother-in-law so this burned some time, but not enough to be served our food by about 8:20 (strike #2). We were helped by one server at a time with respect to our orders being taken and our drinks refilled (which was mostly water) and a good 3-4 servers were ambling around the restaurant attending no one. I honestly felt Gordon Ramsey was going to bust out of the kitchen send the staff home and cook us a real meal. It was terrible service.

What sent me over the edge was the panna cotta dessert. It was sweetened mascarpone with chocolate shavings. No thickness or texture, just a poor substitute for actual panna cotta. 

There is a "smoking" area which doubles as the patio of the restaurant. Perhaps it was the owner or manager of the place smoking, but this was pretty disgusting and the ACTUAL smoking area was right by the main entrance to the restaurant. 

When you walk in, you see a phone booth with letters to the owners praising how good this place used to be (?). Conveniently there are also printed directions on the wall to give to your party on how to arrive here. My suggestion is to go to the phone booth here (even if you do not eat here), call someone and have a conversation along these lines:

Me - Hello (your name here)?
You - oh hi Will what's up?
Me - hey I just called to tell you how much Michel et Angelos sucks!
You - oh wow thanks for that!
Me - yeah here are the directions to this place so that even if the fate of the human race after the zombie apocalypse depended on me or you eating some of this gruel that passes for Italian food, you NEVER come here.
You - Thanks for "slump busting" this one Will, I'm going to buy you a smoked meat sandwich at Schwarz's.
Me - Score major!

We attended a birthday party of about 40 people here. We were prepared to wait a little while for food given the size of the event, so that was fine, took about an hour after ordering to get our meals (once people who had ordered appetizers had eaten)
My boyfriend ordered fettuccine Alfredo with chicken, and it was bland and had the consistency of paste. He asked for extra chicken in it and received about 4 morsels total.
I ordered chicken parmigiana, with a side of spaghetti. The sauce was very acidic, and the potion of spaghetti was less than a tin of chef Boyardee. And my chicken, while a decent size, was burned to a crisp. Didn't bother sending it back as I didn't want to wait another hour. 
Was not impressed.

24 novembre 2012
Souper de famille pour célébrer plusieurs anniversaires de naissance en même temps.
Un restaurant décevant, loin d'être à la hauteur de la cuisine italienne qu'il est censé servir. Tout commence à la réception, la réservation était perdue, nos invités ont donc dû attendre. Pendant ce temps, les serveurs aménageaient une table dans une salle de réception adjacente, couverte d'un plafond métallique, qui amplifie, évidemment, le bruit ambiant. Nous étions tous cordés comme des petites poules dans un poulailler, avec à peine l'espace pour bouger durant le repas. Inacceptable.

La salle était évidemment remplie à craquer, donc nous n'avions aucune chance de discuter convenablement. La commande s'est effectuée à 30 minutes de notre arrivée. Le service des entrées s'est fait 20 minutes plus tard. Il était environ 19h20. Une entrée très simple de zucchini frits, très salés à 10,95 $, c'est 3 fois la valeur de ce plat assez simple composé de sauces commerciales, très facile à réaliser et sans punch particulier. Ordinaire. Je décide de me commander une lasagne en plat principal, histoire de mettre à l'épreuve le restaurant. Si un restaurant italien rate sa lasagne ou ses pâtes, c'est terminé, il ne peut pas être qualifié de restaurant italien. Pour 15,95 $ vous recevez donc UN GROS BLOC DE LASAGNE SANS AUCUN GRATINAGE !!!...le fromage était simplement fondu, une sauce à la viande considérablement salée, environ 1 pouce et demi d'épais, constituée de pâtes assez molles, dans une assiette blanche sans aucune décoration d'accompagnement ..... pour 15,95 $ ! Ça laisse un goût amer ! Ça ne vaut pas plus que 7,95 $ ! La lasagne TOMASO est encore meilleure et elle coûte la moitié du prix !

"Maman, ta lasagne est mille fois meilleure et elle comporte tous les éléments nécessaires propres à la lasagne !!!"

Un autre convive m'a indiqué que ses pâtes-moules-crevettes-pétoncles goûtaient tous la même chose.... Dommage encore. La cible est une fois de plus ratée.

Comme dessert, je commande un Tiramisu, excellent, ...... "une chance....", mais à 6,25 $. Fait sur place ? Je fais ajouter un capuccino double pour 4,50 $...... il fut suffisamment corsé. Ceux et celles qui me connaissent bien savent à quel point pour moi un bon café c'est sacré. Je préfère toujours commander à la carte pour m'assurer d'avoir un café convenable. Les cafés filtres pourraient être meilleurs dans les restaurants si on les préparait à la presse française (BODUM) ou... ... ... mettez simplement plus de café dans le filtre à café !

Globalement, je crois que l'expérience fut très moyenne, des assiettes à peine ou pas décorées, donc loin de la présentation espérée en fonction des prix. On trouve encore bien mieux, au même prix. Un endroit qui s'oublie facilement. Je passe mon tour.

November 24, 2012
We are all gathered to celebrate many upcoming and past birthdays.

What a deception. At the reception, they lost the reservation. What's not new, of course ! Far from being caracterized as "italian restaurant" but it should be, based on the menu, the waiters were busy preparing us a table in a metallic-roofed room adjacent to the main restaurant room. Unplaisantly loud and obnoxious place, a severe lack of space, minimal vital space ! to EAT AT OUR TABLE... The lack of space is simply unacceptable.

It took them 30 minutes to get our order, then 20 minutes to bring the entrées. PLEASE, I cook faster then that. I decided to test the restaurant. Entrée : fried salty zucchini for 10,95 $ which is 3 times overvalued for a very simple dish made with commercial sauces easily prepared, punchless. Ordinary. Main course : lasagna. Seriously, the worse, salty, thick and too cooked slab of lasagne, with NOT A SINGLE BROILED CORNER, NO DECORATION IN THE PLATE, really !!! ..... 15,95$ It leaves a bad taste in your mouth. It doesn't cost more than 7,95 $ ! TOMASO'S lasagna is better and costs half of that price !

"Mom, your lasagna is a thousand times better than this one and it respects all the necessary standards of the real italian lasagna !!! "

A member of my family told me his plate of pastas-shrimps-etc. tasted all the same. Again, they miserably missed the shot.

As a desert I chose a Tiramisu for 6,25 $ Home made ? I doubt it. I ask for a double capuccino for 4,50 $. The first well done part of the meal. I prefer to order "a la carte" since I'm sure my coffee will be a good coffee. If only they prepared their coffee with a french press (BODUM), they would serve good infusion coffee... or ... ... ... just put MORE coffee in the coffee machine !

In general, a missed chance to show the bright side of italian cuisine. Low to no plate presentation in regards to the prices seen in the menu. An really really ordinary experience in a very ordinary and single place, easily forgotten among well managed and prepared restaurants, even for Montreal's south shore. Pass your turn.
